newsitem.title: SPAIN: Spain wants same yardstick as France for EMU entry.
newsitem.headline: Spain wants same yardstick as France for EMU entry.

text.p: Spain and France's economic credentials must be judged by the same yardstick when the time comes to decide who can join a European currency, Spanish Foreign Minister Abel Matutes said on Monday.

"Obviously there will be no difference between France and Spain," Matutes told journalists when asked whether Spain would require similar treatment in case allowances were made for France not meeting the criteria strictly.

Matutes, speaking to journalists before the start later on Monday of the two-day Franco-Spanish summit in Marseilles, emphasised that all countries must be judged by the same criteria when Euro launch participants are chosen.
"All the countries that enter EMU are going to be in the same condition, with the same rights and the same obligations," Matutes said.
